trans-unit.source: DPM Protection of SharePoint farm to Azure | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: DPM Protection of SharePoint farm to Azure | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview of DPM Protection of SharePoint farm to Azure
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview of DPM Protection of SharePoint farm to Azure

trans-unit.source: Backing up a SharePoint farm to Azure
trans-unit.target: Backing up a SharePoint farm to Azure

trans-unit.source: You back up a SharePoint farm to Azure using System Center Data Protection Manager (DPM) in much the same way you back up other data sources.
trans-unit.target: You back up a SharePoint farm to Azure using System Center Data Protection Manager (DPM) in much the same way you back up other data sources.

trans-unit.source: Azure provides flexibility in the backup schedule to create daily, weekly, monthly or yearly backup points and gives you varying retention policy options for various backup points.
trans-unit.target: Azure provides flexibility in the backup schedule to create daily, weekly, monthly or yearly backup points and gives you varying retention policy options for various backup points.

trans-unit.source: DPM provides you capability to store local disk copies for quicker recovery time objectives (RTO) and to Azure for a cost effective long term retention target.
trans-unit.target: DPM provides you capability to store local disk copies for quicker recovery time objectives (RTO) and to Azure for a cost effective long term retention target.

trans-unit.source: SharePoint supported versions and related protection scenarios
trans-unit.target: SharePoint supported versions and related protection scenarios

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup for DPM supports the following scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup for DPM supports the following scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Workload
trans-unit.target: Workload

trans-unit.source: Version
trans-unit.target: Version

trans-unit.source: SharePoint deployment
trans-unit.target: SharePoint deployment

trans-unit.source: DPM deployment type
trans-unit.target: DPM deployment type

trans-unit.source: DPM - System Center 2012 R2
trans-unit.target: DPM - System Center 2012 R2

trans-unit.source: Protection and Recovery
trans-unit.target: Protection and Recovery

trans-unit.source: SharePoint
trans-unit.target: SharePoint

trans-unit.source: SharePoint 2013, SharePoint 2010, SharePoint 2007, SharePoint 3.0
trans-unit.target: SharePoint 2013, SharePoint 2010, SharePoint 2007, SharePoint 3.0

trans-unit.source: SharePoint deployed as a physical server or Hyper-V/VmWare virtual machine
trans-unit.target: SharePoint deployed as a physical server or Hyper-V/VmWare virtual machine

trans-unit.source: SQL AlwaysOn
trans-unit.target: SQL AlwaysOn

trans-unit.source: Physical server or on-premises Hyper-V Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Physical server or on-premises Hyper-V Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: Supports back up to Azure from Update Rollup 5
trans-unit.target: Supports back up to Azure from Update Rollup 5

trans-unit.source: Protect SharePoint Farm Recover: Farm, database, file or list item from disk and recovery farm and database from Azure
trans-unit.target: Protect SharePoint Farm Recover: Farm, database, file or list item from disk and recovery farm and database from Azure

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: There are a few things you need to ensure before backing up a SharePoint farm to Azure.
trans-unit.target: There are a few things you need to ensure before backing up a SharePoint farm to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you proceed, ensure that all the [prerequisites](backup-azure-dpm-introduction.md#prerequisites) for using Microsoft Azure Backup to protect workloads have been met.
trans-unit.target: Before you proceed, ensure that all the [prerequisites](backup-azure-dpm-introduction.md#prerequisites) for using Microsoft Azure Backup to protect workloads have been met.

trans-unit.source: The prerequisites cover tasks such as: creating a backup vault, downloading vault credentials, installing the Azure Backup Agent and registering the server with the vault.
trans-unit.target: The prerequisites cover tasks such as: creating a backup vault, downloading vault credentials, installing the Azure Backup Agent and registering the server with the vault.

trans-unit.source: DPM agent
trans-unit.target: DPM agent

trans-unit.source: The DPM agent must be installed on the SharePoint server, SQL servers, and any other servers that are part of the SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: The DPM agent must be installed on the SharePoint server, SQL servers, and any other servers that are part of the SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: For more information about setting up the protection agent, see [Setup Protection Agent](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh758039.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about setting up the protection agent, see [Setup Protection Agent](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh758039.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The only exception is that you only install the agent on a single Web Front End (WFE) server.
trans-unit.target: The only exception is that you only install the agent on a single Web Front End (WFE) server.

trans-unit.source: DPM only needs the agent on one WFE server to serve as the entry point for protection.
trans-unit.target: DPM only needs the agent on one WFE server to serve as the entry point for protection.

trans-unit.source: SharePoint farm
trans-unit.target: SharePoint farm

trans-unit.source: For every 10 million items in the farm, there must be at least 2 GB of space on the volume where the DPM folder is located.
trans-unit.target: For every 10 million items in the farm, there must be at least 2 GB of space on the volume where the DPM folder is located.

trans-unit.source: This space is required for catalog generation.
trans-unit.target: This space is required for catalog generation.

trans-unit.source: For DPM to recover specific items (site collections, sites, lists, document libraries, folders, individual documents, and list items), catalog generation creates a list of the URLs contained within each content database.
trans-unit.target: For DPM to recover specific items (site collections, sites, lists, document libraries, folders, individual documents, and list items), catalog generation creates a list of the URLs contained within each content database.

trans-unit.source: You can view the list of URLs in the recoverable item pane in the Recovery task area of DPM Administrator Console.
trans-unit.target: You can view the list of URLs in the recoverable item pane in the Recovery task area of DPM Administrator Console.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server
trans-unit.target: SQL Server

trans-unit.source: DPM runs as a Local System and to back up SQL Server databases it needs sysadmin privileges on that account for the SQL server.
trans-unit.target: DPM runs as a Local System and to back up SQL Server databases it needs sysadmin privileges on that account for the SQL server.

trans-unit.source: Set NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM to *sysadmin* on the SQL Server you want to back up.
trans-unit.target: Set NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM to *sysadmin* on the SQL Server you want to back up.

trans-unit.source: In the SharePoint farm, if you have SQL Server databases that are configured with SQL Server aliases, install the SQL Server client components on the front-end Web server that DPM will protect.
trans-unit.target: In the SharePoint farm, if you have SQL Server databases that are configured with SQL Server aliases, install the SQL Server client components on the front-end Web server that DPM will protect.

trans-unit.source: SharePoint Server
trans-unit.target: SharePoint Server

trans-unit.source: While performance depends on many factors such as size of SharePoint farm, as general guidance one DPM Server can be used to protect a 25TB SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: While performance depends on many factors such as size of SharePoint farm, as general guidance one DPM Server can be used to protect a 25TB SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: DPM Update Rollup 5
trans-unit.target: DPM Update Rollup 5

trans-unit.source: To begin protection of a SharePoint farm to Azure, you need to install DPM Update Rollup 5 or higher.
trans-unit.target: To begin protection of a SharePoint farm to Azure, you need to install DPM Update Rollup 5 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Update Rollup 5 provides the ability to protect a SharePoint farm (configured using SQL AlwaysOn) to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Update Rollup 5 provides the ability to protect a SharePoint farm (configured using SQL AlwaysOn) to Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information see [installing DPM Update Rollup 5]( http://blogs.technet.com/b/dpm/archive/2015/02/11/update-rollup-5-for-system-center-2012-r2-data-protection-manager-is-now-available.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For more information see [installing DPM Update Rollup 5]( http://blogs.technet.com/b/dpm/archive/2015/02/11/update-rollup-5-for-system-center-2012-r2-data-protection-manager-is-now-available.aspx)

trans-unit.source: What's not supported
trans-unit.target: What's not supported

trans-unit.source: Protecting a SharePoint farm does not protect search indexes or application service databases.
trans-unit.target: Protecting a SharePoint farm does not protect search indexes or application service databases.

trans-unit.source: You will need to configure the protection of these databases separately.
trans-unit.target: You will need to configure the protection of these databases separately.

trans-unit.source: DPM does not provide backup of SharePoint SQL databases hosted on Scale out file server (SOFS) shares.
trans-unit.target: DPM does not provide backup of SharePoint SQL databases hosted on Scale out file server (SOFS) shares.

trans-unit.source: Configure SharePoint Protection
trans-unit.target: Configure SharePoint Protection

trans-unit.source: You must configure the SharePoint VSS Writer service (WSS Writer service) using **ConfigureSharePoint.exe** before you can protect SharePoint using DPM.
trans-unit.target: You must configure the SharePoint VSS Writer service (WSS Writer service) using **ConfigureSharePoint.exe** before you can protect SharePoint using DPM.

trans-unit.source: You can find **ConfigureSharePoint.exe** in the [DPM Installation Path]\bin folder on the front-end Web server.
trans-unit.target: You can find **ConfigureSharePoint.exe** in the [DPM Installation Path]\bin folder on the front-end Web server.

trans-unit.source: This tool provides the protection agent with the credentials for the SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: This tool provides the protection agent with the credentials for the SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: You run it on a single WFE server.
trans-unit.target: You run it on a single WFE server.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple WFE servers select just one when you configure a protection group.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple WFE servers select just one when you configure a protection group.

trans-unit.source: To configure the SharePoint VSS Writer service
trans-unit.target: To configure the SharePoint VSS Writer service

trans-unit.source: On the WFE server, at a command prompt, go to [DPM installation location]\bin\
trans-unit.target: On the WFE server, at a command prompt, go to [DPM installation location]\bin\

trans-unit.source: Run ConfigureSharePoint -EnableSharePointProtection
trans-unit.target: Run ConfigureSharePoint -EnableSharePointProtection

trans-unit.source: Enter the farm administrator credentials.
trans-unit.target: Enter the farm administrator credentials.

trans-unit.source: This account should be a member of the local Administrator group on the WFE server.
trans-unit.target: This account should be a member of the local Administrator group on the WFE server.

trans-unit.source: If the farm administrator isn’t a local admin grant the following permissions on the WFE server:
trans-unit.target: If the farm administrator isn’t a local admin grant the following permissions on the WFE server:

trans-unit.source: Grant the WSS_Admin_WPG group full control to the DPM folder (%Program Files%\Microsoft Data Protection Manager\DPM).
trans-unit.target: Grant the WSS_Admin_WPG group full control to the DPM folder (%Program Files%\Microsoft Data Protection Manager\DPM).

trans-unit.source: Grant the WSS_Admin_WPG group read access to the DPM Registry key (HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Data Protection Manager).
trans-unit.target: Grant the WSS_Admin_WPG group read access to the DPM Registry key (HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Data Protection Manager).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You’ll need to rerun ConfigureSharePoint.exe whenever there’s a change in the SharePoint farm administrator credentials.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You’ll need to rerun ConfigureSharePoint.exe whenever there’s a change in the SharePoint farm administrator credentials.

trans-unit.source: Back up a SharePoint farm using DPM
trans-unit.target: Back up a SharePoint farm using DPM

trans-unit.source: Once you have configured DPM and the SharePoint farm as explained above, SharePoint can be protected by DPM.
trans-unit.target: Once you have configured DPM and the SharePoint farm as explained above, SharePoint can be protected by DPM.

trans-unit.source: To protect a SharePoint farm
trans-unit.target: To protect a SharePoint farm

trans-unit.source: From the **Protection** tab of the DPM Administrator Console, click **New**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Protection** tab of the DPM Administrator Console, click **New**.

trans-unit.source: ![New Protection Tab](./media/backup-azure-backup-sharepoint/dpm-new-protection-tab.png)
trans-unit.target: ![New Protection Tab](./media/backup-azure-backup-sharepoint/dpm-new-protection-tab.png)

trans-unit.source: On the **Select Protection Group Type** screen of the **Create New Protection Group** wizard, select **Servers** and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Select Protection Group Type** screen of the **Create New Protection Group** wizard, select **Servers** and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Select Protection Group type
trans-unit.target: Select Protection Group type

trans-unit.source: On the **Select Group Members** screen, select the check box for the SharePoint server you want to protect and click **Next**
trans-unit.target: On the **Select Group Members** screen, select the check box for the SharePoint server you want to protect and click **Next**

trans-unit.source: Select group members
trans-unit.target: Select group members

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] With the DPM agent installed, you can see the server in the wizard.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] With the DPM agent installed, you can see the server in the wizard.

trans-unit.source: DPM also shows its structure.
trans-unit.target: DPM also shows its structure.

trans-unit.source: Because ConfigureSharePoint.exe was run, DPM communicates with the SharePoint VSS Writer and its corresponding SQL databases and recognizes the SharePoint farm structure (the associated content databases and any corresponding items).
trans-unit.target: Because ConfigureSharePoint.exe was run, DPM communicates with the SharePoint VSS Writer and its corresponding SQL databases and recognizes the SharePoint farm structure (the associated content databases and any corresponding items).

trans-unit.source: On the **Select Data Protection Method** screen, enter the name of the *Protection Group* and select your preferred *protection methods*.
trans-unit.target: On the **Select Data Protection Method** screen, enter the name of the *Protection Group* and select your preferred *protection methods*.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Select data protection method
trans-unit.target: Select data protection method

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Choosing disk protection helps to meet recovery time objectives with short recovery times.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Choosing disk protection helps to meet recovery time objectives with short recovery times.

trans-unit.source: Azure is a cost effective long-term protection target compared to tapes.
trans-unit.target: Azure is a cost effective long-term protection target compared to tapes.

trans-unit.source: For more information see this [article](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/backup-azure-backup-cloud-as-tape/)
trans-unit.target: For more information see this [article](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/backup-azure-backup-cloud-as-tape/)

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify Short-Term Goals** screen, select your preferred *retention range* and identify when you want backups to occur.
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify Short-Term Goals** screen, select your preferred *retention range* and identify when you want backups to occur.

trans-unit.source: Specify short-term goals
trans-unit.target: Specify short-term goals

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Since recovery is most often required for data less than five days old, we selected a retention range of 5 days on disk and ensured that the backup happens during non-production hours, for this example.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Since recovery is most often required for data less than five days old, we selected a retention range of 5 days on disk and ensured that the backup happens during non-production hours, for this example.

trans-unit.source: Review the storage pool disk space allocated for the protection group and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Review the storage pool disk space allocated for the protection group and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: For every protection group, DPM allocates disk space to store and manage replicas.
trans-unit.target: For every protection group, DPM allocates disk space to store and manage replicas.

trans-unit.source: At this point, DPM must create a copy of the selected data.
trans-unit.target: At this point, DPM must create a copy of the selected data.

trans-unit.source: Select how and when you want the replica created and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select how and when you want the replica created and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Choose replica creation method
trans-unit.target: Choose replica creation method

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To ensure network traffic is not effected, select a time outside production hours.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To ensure network traffic is not effected, select a time outside production hours.

trans-unit.source: DPM ensures data integrity by performing consistency checks on the replica.
trans-unit.target: DPM ensures data integrity by performing consistency checks on the replica.

trans-unit.source: There are two available options.
trans-unit.target: There are two available options.

trans-unit.source: You can define a schedule for running consistency checks, or allow DPM to run consistency checks automatically on the replica whenever it becomes inconsistent.
trans-unit.target: You can define a schedule for running consistency checks, or allow DPM to run consistency checks automatically on the replica whenever it becomes inconsistent.

trans-unit.source: Select your preferred option and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select your preferred option and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Consistency Check
trans-unit.target: Consistency Check

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify Online Protection Data** screen, select the SharePoint farm you want to protect and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify Online Protection Data** screen, select the SharePoint farm you want to protect and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: DPM SharePoint Protection1
trans-unit.target: DPM SharePoint Protection1

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify Online Backup Schedule** screen, select your preferred schedule and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify Online Backup Schedule** screen, select your preferred schedule and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Online_backup_schedule
trans-unit.target: Online_backup_schedule

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] DPM allows 2 daily backups at different times to Azure.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] DPM allows 2 daily backups at different times to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the backup schedule you selected, on the **Specify Online Retention Policy** screen, select the retention policy for daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly backup points.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the backup schedule you selected, on the **Specify Online Retention Policy** screen, select the retention policy for daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly backup points.

trans-unit.source: Online_retention_policy
trans-unit.target: Online_retention_policy

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] DPM uses a Grandfather-father-son retention scheme in which a different retention policy can be chosen for different backup points.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] DPM uses a Grandfather-father-son retention scheme in which a different retention policy can be chosen for different backup points.

trans-unit.source: Similar to disk, an initial reference point replica needs to be created in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Similar to disk, an initial reference point replica needs to be created in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Select your preferred option for creating the initial backup copy to Azure and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select your preferred option for creating the initial backup copy to Azure and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Online_replica
trans-unit.target: Online_replica

trans-unit.source: Review your selected settings on the **Summary** page and click **Create Group**.
trans-unit.target: Review your selected settings on the **Summary** page and click **Create Group**.

trans-unit.source: You will see a success message once the protection group has been created.
trans-unit.target: You will see a success message once the protection group has been created.

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: Restore a SharePoint item from disk using DPM
trans-unit.target: Restore a SharePoint item from disk using DPM

trans-unit.source: In the example below, the *Recovering SharePoint item* has been accidentally deleted and needs to be recovered.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, the *Recovering SharePoint item* has been accidentally deleted and needs to be recovered.

trans-unit.source: ![DPM SharePoint Protection4](./media/backup-azure-backup-sharepoint/dpm-sharepoint-protection5.png)
trans-unit.target: ![DPM SharePoint Protection4](./media/backup-azure-backup-sharepoint/dpm-sharepoint-protection5.png)

trans-unit.source: Open the **DPM Administrator Console**.
trans-unit.target: Open the **DPM Administrator Console**.

trans-unit.source: All SharePoint farms protected by DPM are shown in the Protection tab.
trans-unit.target: All SharePoint farms protected by DPM are shown in the Protection tab.

trans-unit.source: DPM SharePoint Protection3
trans-unit.target: DPM SharePoint Protection3

trans-unit.source: To begin recovering the item, select the **Recovery** tab.
trans-unit.target: To begin recovering the item, select the **Recovery** tab.

trans-unit.source: DPM SharePoint Protection5
trans-unit.target: DPM SharePoint Protection5

trans-unit.source: You can search SharePoint for the *Recovering SharePoint item* using a wild card based search within a recovery point range.
trans-unit.target: You can search SharePoint for the *Recovering SharePoint item* using a wild card based search within a recovery point range.

trans-unit.source: DPM SharePoint Protection6
trans-unit.target: DPM SharePoint Protection6

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate recovery point from the search results, right click, and select **Recover**
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate recovery point from the search results, right click, and select **Recover**

trans-unit.source: You can also navigate through various recovery points and select a database or item to recover.
trans-unit.target: You can also navigate through various recovery points and select a database or item to recover.

trans-unit.source: Select **date > Recovery time** then select the correct **database > SharePoint farm > recovery point > item**.
trans-unit.target: Select **date > Recovery time** then select the correct **database > SharePoint farm > recovery point > item**.

trans-unit.source: DPM SharePoint Protection7
trans-unit.target: DPM SharePoint Protection7

trans-unit.source: Right click the item and select **Recover** to open the **Recovery Wizard**.
trans-unit.target: Right click the item and select **Recover** to open the **Recovery Wizard**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Review Recovery Selection
trans-unit.target: Review Recovery Selection

trans-unit.source: Select the type of recovery you want to perform and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select the type of recovery you want to perform and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Recovery Type
trans-unit.target: Recovery Type

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Example above shows recovery item to original SharePoint site.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Example above shows recovery item to original SharePoint site.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Recovery Process** you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Recovery Process** you want to use.

trans-unit.source: Select **Recover witahout using a recovery farm** if the SharePoint farm has not changed and is the same as the recovery point that is being restored.
trans-unit.target: Select **Recover witahout using a recovery farm** if the SharePoint farm has not changed and is the same as the recovery point that is being restored.

trans-unit.source: Select **Recover using a recovery farm** if the SharePoint farm has changed since the recovery point was created.
trans-unit.target: Select **Recover using a recovery farm** if the SharePoint farm has changed since the recovery point was created.

trans-unit.source: Recovery Process
trans-unit.target: Recovery Process

trans-unit.source: Provide a staging SQL instance location for recovering the database temporarily, and provide a staging file share on the DPM Server and SharePoint server to recover the item.
trans-unit.target: Provide a staging SQL instance location for recovering the database temporarily, and provide a staging file share on the DPM Server and SharePoint server to recover the item.

trans-unit.source: Staging Location1
trans-unit.target: Staging Location1

trans-unit.source: DPM attaches the content database, which is hosting the SharePoint item, to the temporary SQL Instance.
trans-unit.target: DPM attaches the content database, which is hosting the SharePoint item, to the temporary SQL Instance.

trans-unit.source: From the content database the DPM Server recovers the item and puts it on the staging file location on the DPM server.
trans-unit.target: From the content database the DPM Server recovers the item and puts it on the staging file location on the DPM server.

trans-unit.source: The item recovered on the staging location, on the DPM server, now needs to be exported to the staging location on the SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: The item recovered on the staging location, on the DPM server, now needs to be exported to the staging location on the SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: Staging Location2
trans-unit.target: Staging Location2

trans-unit.source: Select **Specify recovery options** and apply security settings to the SharePoint farm or apply the security settings of the recovery point.
trans-unit.target: Select **Specify recovery options** and apply security settings to the SharePoint farm or apply the security settings of the recovery point.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Recovery Options
trans-unit.target: Recovery Options

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can choose to throttle the network bandwidth usage.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can choose to throttle the network bandwidth usage.

trans-unit.source: This minimizes impact to the production server during production hours.
trans-unit.target: This minimizes impact to the production server during production hours.

trans-unit.source: Review the summary information and click **Recover** to begin recovery of the file.
trans-unit.target: Review the summary information and click **Recover** to begin recovery of the file.

trans-unit.source: Recovery summary
trans-unit.target: Recovery summary

trans-unit.source: Now select the **Monitoring** tab in the **DPM Administrator Console** to view the *Status* of the recovery.
trans-unit.target: Now select the **Monitoring** tab in the **DPM Administrator Console** to view the *Status* of the recovery.

trans-unit.source: Recovery Status
trans-unit.target: Recovery Status

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The file is now restored.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The file is now restored.

trans-unit.source: You can refresh the SharePoint site to check the restored file.
trans-unit.target: You can refresh the SharePoint site to check the restored file.

trans-unit.source: Restore a SharePoint database from Azure using DPM
trans-unit.target: Restore a SharePoint database from Azure using DPM

trans-unit.source: To recover a SharePoint content database, navigate through various recovery points (as shown above) and select the recovery point to you want to recover.
trans-unit.target: To recover a SharePoint content database, navigate through various recovery points (as shown above) and select the recovery point to you want to recover.

trans-unit.source: DPM SharePoint Protection8
trans-unit.target: DPM SharePoint Protection8

trans-unit.source: Double-click the SharePoint recovery point to show the available SharePoint catalog information.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the SharePoint recovery point to show the available SharePoint catalog information.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Since the SharePoint farm is protected for long term retention in Azure, no catalog information (meta data) is available on the DPM Server.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Since the SharePoint farm is protected for long term retention in Azure, no catalog information (meta data) is available on the DPM Server.

trans-unit.source: As a result, whenever a point-in-time SharePoint content database needs to be recovered you need to re-catalog the SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: As a result, whenever a point-in-time SharePoint content database needs to be recovered you need to re-catalog the SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: Click **Re-catalog**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Re-catalog**.

trans-unit.source: DPM SharePoint Protection10
trans-unit.target: DPM SharePoint Protection10

trans-unit.source: The **Cloud Recatalog** status window appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Cloud Recatalog** status window appears.

trans-unit.source: DPM SharePoint Protection11
trans-unit.target: DPM SharePoint Protection11

trans-unit.source: Once cataloging is complete, the status changes to *Success*.
trans-unit.target: Once cataloging is complete, the status changes to *Success*.

trans-unit.source: Click **Close**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Close**.

trans-unit.source: DPM SharePoint Protection12
trans-unit.target: DPM SharePoint Protection12

trans-unit.source: Click the SharePoint object shown in DPM **Recovery** tab to get the content database structure.
trans-unit.target: Click the SharePoint object shown in DPM **Recovery** tab to get the content database structure.

trans-unit.source: Right click > **Recover**.
trans-unit.target: Right click > **Recover**.

trans-unit.source: DPM SharePoint Protection13
trans-unit.target: DPM SharePoint Protection13

trans-unit.source: At this point, follow the [recovery steps above](#restore-a-sharepoint-item-from-disk-using-dpm) for recovering a Sharepoint content database from disk.
trans-unit.target: At this point, follow the [recovery steps above](#restore-a-sharepoint-item-from-disk-using-dpm) for recovering a Sharepoint content database from disk.

trans-unit.source: FAQs
trans-unit.target: FAQs

trans-unit.source: Q: Which versions of DPM support SQL 2014 and SQL 2012 (SP2)
trans-unit.target: Q: Which versions of DPM support SQL 2014 and SQL 2012 (SP2)

trans-unit.source: A: DPM 2012 R2 with Update Rollup 4 supports the same
trans-unit.target: A: DPM 2012 R2 with Update Rollup 4 supports the same

trans-unit.source: Q: Can I recover SharePoint item to the original location if SharePoint is configured using SQL AlwaysOn (with protection on disk)?
trans-unit.target: Q: Can I recover SharePoint item to the original location if SharePoint is configured using SQL AlwaysOn (with protection on disk)?

trans-unit.source: A: Yes the item can be recovered to the original SharePoint site
trans-unit.target: A: Yes the item can be recovered to the original SharePoint site

trans-unit.source: Q: Can I recover a SharePoint database to the original location if SharePoint is configured using SQL AlwaysOn?
trans-unit.target: Q: Can I recover a SharePoint database to the original location if SharePoint is configured using SQL AlwaysOn?

trans-unit.source: A: Since SharePoint databases are configured in SQL AlwaysOn, they cannot be modified unless the availability group (AG) is removed.
trans-unit.target: A: Since SharePoint databases are configured in SQL AlwaysOn, they cannot be modified unless the availability group (AG) is removed.

trans-unit.source: As a result DPM cannot restore database to original location.
trans-unit.target: As a result DPM cannot restore database to original location.

trans-unit.source: You can recovery SQL database to another SQL instance.
trans-unit.target: You can recovery SQL database to another SQL instance.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps
